Issues.Title: feat(ivy): error in ivy when inheriting a ctor from an undecorated base
Issues.Body:
Angular View Engine uses global knowledge to compile the following code:

```typescript
export class Base {
  constructor(private vcr: ViewContainerRef) {}
}

@Directive({...})
export class Dir extends Base {
  // constructor inherited from base
}
```

Here, `Dir` extends `Base` and inherits its constructor. To create a `Dir`
the arguments to this inherited constructor must be obtained via dependency
injection. View Engine is able to generate a correct factory for `Dir` to do
this because via metadata it knows the arguments of `Base`'s constructor,
even if `Base` is declared in a different library.

In Ivy, DI is entirely a runtime concept. Currently `Dir` is compiled with
an ngDirectiveDef field that delegates its factory to `getInheritedFactory`.
This looks for some kind of factory function on `Base`, which comes up
empty. This case looks identical to an inheritance chain with no
constructors, which works today in Ivy.

Both of these cases will now become an error in this commit. If a decorated
class inherits from an undecorated base class, a diagnostic is produced
informing the user of the need to either explicitly declare a constructor or
to decorate the base class.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(ivy): error in ivy when inheriting a ctor from an undecorated base" (#31271)

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/31118 and https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/31252 made changes to some of the placeholder styling on AIO.

I tested the changes in Firefox and these versions (plus previous versions) have the same issue of being overly transparent and not meeting a11y contrast guidelines that we saw in AngularJS Material (https://github.com/angular/material/pull/11497).

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
- https://pr31252-bb25150.ngbuilds.io/api
- https://next.angular.io/api
- https://angular.io/api

### Reproduction Steps**
Inspect the placeholder styling of the filter input.
Run a Lighthouse A11y audit against the page.

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
The placeholder text and background should have a recommended contrast of 4.5 (AA).

## üì∑Screenshot
Firefox:
![Screen Shot 2019-06-25 at 14 47 46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3506071/60124777-617cdd00-9758-11e9-8305-2c0af9e2a0fa.png)
This is unreadable for many people, even those without significant vision issues.

Chrome:
![Screen Shot 2019-06-25 at 14 47 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3506071/60124779-63df3700-9758-11e9-90a5-51a8f26270b8.png)
This color is still well under the recommended contrast guidelines for a11y
![Screen Shot 2019-06-25 at 15 29 19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3506071/60127387-12d24180-975e-11e9-995b-e1f751efc7bc.png)


## üî• Exception or Error
Contrast ratio of `1.45` is well under AA recommendation of `4.5`.

## üåç  Your Environment

### Browser info
Chrome 75 and Firefox `67.0.3`

### Anything else relevant?
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èPlease provide additional info if necessary. -->

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): separate vendor-specific CSS selectors
Issues.Body:
In #31118, some vendor-specific selectors were combined in one rule-set. As pointed out in [this comment][1], this would result in the whole rule-set being ignored by all browsers, since one invalid/unrecognized selector invalidates the declaration block.

This commit fixes it by defining a separate rule-set per selector. The list of vendor-specific selectors is also adjusted to better target the currently supported browsers.

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/31118/files#r296923652
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR " fix(docs-infra): separate vendor-specific CSS selectors" (#31252)

Issues.Title: build: use checked-in configuration from bazel-toolchains
Issues.Body:

for working on the Angular repository since we can leverage the checked-in

Issues.Title: Documenting how to update to specific angular version with `ng update`.
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)

```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description

There are some situation that we want to update to specific version, to not latest angular version.

But, there are no description for how to update to specific angular version with `ng update` in [update.angular.io](https://update.angular.io/) and [ng update reference](https://angular.io/cli/update). Caution: not "migrate only update". I refer about update the installed version.

By the way, Acording to [angular-cli/docs/specifications/update.md](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v8.0.4/docs/specifications/update.md) ,

> Each package follows the convention of [@scope/]packageName[@version-range-or-dist-tag]. 

So we can use next command to update specific Angular version.

```
ng update @angular/cli@7.0.0 @angular/core@7.0.0
```

Is this above method that update to specific version is defined correctly?
And this is a little hard to find how to update to specific version.
I am so happy if there is documented at [update.angular.io](https://update.angular.io/) or [ng update reference](https://angular.io/cli/update).

related : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52970467/ng-update-to-specific-angular-version

### Describe the solution you'd like

How about documenting how to update to specific angular version with `ng update` in [update.angular.io](https://update.angular.io/) and [ng update reference](https://angular.io/cli/update)?

```
ng update @angular/cli@7.0.0 @angular/core@7.0.0
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Documenting how to update to specific angular version with `ng update`." (#31259)

Issues.Title: Angular 8 Service Worker Support for Conditionally Download ES5 or Es2015 bundles
Issues.Body:
This feature request is for `@angular/pwa`

### Description
With Angular 8 we now have support for Differential Loading, and Angular compiler produces two bundles one for ES5 and other for ES2015 and browser can choose between modern or legacy JavaScript based on its own capabilities.

This works fine, unless we are using Angular Service worker, but when we have a progressive web app, Angular Service Worker prefetchs, all JavaScript bundles i.e. ES5 and ES2015 bundles.

So, there should be an option in service worker to download the bundles on the basis of browser capabilities and it should download either ES5 or Es2015 bundles not both.

### Describe the solution you'd like
May be some option could be provided in `ngsw-config.json` file e.g. a property for `assetGroups` through which we could specify when assets in this group should be downloaded (legacy/modern browser).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular 8 Service Worker Support for Conditionally Download ES5 or Es2015 bundles" (#31256)

Issues.Body:
Hi Team,

While loading one page the user navigate to another page before successfully the previous page loads it causing some errors. It appending the previous page to current one.

How can  we kill the previous page if the user navigate to another page immediately or before successfully load that page.

Issues.Title: ci: upgrade clang-format to 1.0.27 to match master
Issues.Body: We need to update the patch branch to the same version of clang-format as master. Otherwise changes cherry-picked to both master and patch may fail on patch because the linter standards are different.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: upgrade clang-format to 1.0.27 to match master" (#31247)

Issues.Title: ci(docs-infra): re-enable payload size checking for `test_aio_local` and `test_aio_local_ivy`
Issues.Body:
Previously, payload size checking for `test_aio_local` and `test_aio_local_ivy` was disabled on the 8.0.x branch (in #31064), because the numbers (which were cherry-picked from master) did not match the actual sizes.

This commit updates the numbers for the 8.0.x branch and re-enables the checks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci(docs-infra): re-enable payload size checking for `test_aio_local` and `test_aio_local_ivy`" (#31243)

Issues.Body:
Used existing `alert` class styling for consistency with modifications to make more prominent. To consider: If this mode-banner is going to show up on every page, we might want a full page banner (such as below the toolbar, or above it as a sticky banner). Issues.Title: web worker with deploy-url CDN cause SecurityError
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? no ### Description Angular 8 support build web worker command, but when the app deploys to CDN with ` --deploy-url`, the web worker ts will also loaded from the CDN URL. This will cause cross domain error ``` ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): SecurityError: Failed to construct 'Worker': ``` It makes that impossible to use web worker with `@angular/cli` in the production environment Angular CLI should support cross-domain web worker loader with options or by default * add plugin to `worker-plugin` like the code below https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin#plugins ```ts async () => { const codeString = await fetch(originWorkerUrl).then(res => res.text()); const localWorkerUrl = window.URL.createObjectURL(new Blob([codeString], { type: 'application/javascript' })); } ``` * or replace `worker-plugin` with `worker-loader` which support cross-origin-policy https://github.com/webpack-contrib/worker-loader#cross-origin-policy https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/277d4abd4b3172abbcd7b7c3bbe83d894887f9f7/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/worker.ts#L13 * or should give an option to deploy the web worker build out to the assets folder ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://angular.io/guide/web-worker with `ng build --prod --deploy-url` to any CDN url can easily reproduce this error ## üî• Exception or Error 

ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): SecurityError: Failed to construct 'Worker': Script at 'http://assets.daily.xxx.net/xxx.worker.js' cannot be accessed from origin 'http://daily.abc.xxx.net'.

Error: Failed to construct 'Worker': Script at 'http://assets.daily.xxx.net/xxx.worker.js' cannot be accessed from origin 'http://daily.abc.xxx.net'.

Issues.Title: Error when using exported interface
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8.0.3 (See "anything else relevant" section, exact bug has appeared and been fixed before) ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... Using an exported interface produces an error, app is not served. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction export an interface: ``` export interface AppConfig {..} export let APP_CONFIG = new InjectionToken('app.config'); ``` Import it elsewhere: `import { APP_CONFIG, AppConfig } from '../app.config';` Use it: ``` export class MyService { constructor(@Inject(APP_CONFIG) config: AppConfig,... ... } ``` ## üî• Exception or Error ng serve

Issues.Title: polyfills-es5 doesn't check to see if promise is already added
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... 7.x ### Description We have a container app that loads Angular apps into it (the architecture is a nightmare). The code looks like: ``` $('.container').html('the index.html from angular dist folder'); ``` Prior to Angular 8 and differential loading, you could do this as many times as you wanted - I believe the polyfill that was used checked to see if promise was already polyfilled. Post Angular 8, the second time you do this, you will see: ``` VM885:1 Unhandled promise rejection Error: Zone.js has detected that ZoneAwarePromise `(window|global).Promise` has been overwritten. Most likely cause is that a Promise polyfill has been loaded after Zone.js (Polyfilling Promise api is not necessary when zone.js is loaded. If you must load one, do so before loading zone.js.) ``` I'm guessing that the polyfills-es5 file assumes that it will only be loaded once and therefore doesn't make the same check to see if it's been polyfilled already. (as a side note, when using $().html() on a script with "nomodule", the nomodule is ignored so this issue effects all browsers). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1) Create a brand new app (I used nx workspaces so: ng g app myapp) 2) Set your tsconfig to es5 not es2015 (we can't go to es2015 because of https://github.com/angular/flex-layout/issues/950) NOTE - You can reproduce this with es2015 by removing nomodule but it is simpler to reproduce in es5 3) ng build --prod 4) Since you're probably testing this in Chrome, remove "nomodule" from polyfills-es5 (this is reproducible in IE 11 without removing nomodule) 5) Make a copy of the runtime and polyfills scripts and place them below your original scripts: ``` ``` 6) Get zoneaware promise error ## üî• Exception or Error 

VM885:1 Unhandled promise rejection Error: Zone.js has detected that ZoneAwarePromise `(window|global).Promise` has been overwritten.
Most likely cause is that a Promise polyfill has been loaded after Zone.js (Polyfilling Promise api is not necessary when zone.js is loaded. If you must load one, do so before loading zone.js.)
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 8.0.4
Node: 12.4.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 8.0.2
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Issues.Title: NullInjectorError when running with --prod
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes this is a regression in `@angular-devkit/build-angular` starting from `0.800.2` (works with `0.800.1`). ### Description After building or serving with `--prod` (probably the build optimizer when I look at changes between `0.800.1` and `0.800.2`) I get a `NullInjectorError` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction DI setup: - App module - Core module -> NGXS/States - NGXS bootstraps/initializes the states - `AuthState` -> (`Store`, `AuthApiService`, `LoggerService`) The one not found is the `AuthApiService`. I am aware that this might as well be an issue with NGXS and that this is not really a viable way for you guys to reproduce the issue. But given the very few commits between 0.800.1 and 0.800.2 I though you might be able to still pin down the issue or give me more information on why this issue occurs now. If not, I might be able to dig deeper and/or figure out if it's an NGXS issue and/or reproduce it minimally. However, it is a regression. ## üî• Exception or Error 

core.js.pre-build-optimizer.js:1354 Uncaught NullInjectorError: StaticInjectorError(s)[r -> a]: 
  StaticInjectorError(Platform: core)[r -> a]:

Issues.Title: Add `@angular/compiler-cli` version `8.1.0-next.0` as `peerDependency`
Issues.Body:
**fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add `@angular/compiler-cli` version `8.1.0-next.0` as `peerDependency`**
 
**fix(@ngtools/webpack): add `@angular/compiler-cli` version `8.1.0-next.0` as `peerDependency`**
 
**test: add `--force` to version 7 migration when updating prerelease versions**

We only use it for a few things but have a strict peerdep.

This strictness causes errors when updating the CLI from 7.x to 8.1 next projects:

Package "@angular-devkit/build-angular" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/compiler-cli" (requires ">=8.0.0-beta.0 < 9.0.0" (extended), would install "8.1.0-next.3").
`build-angular` didn't have a peerdep on `@angular/compiler-cli` that supported `8.1.0-next`

This PR relaxes this requirement.

After the other commits get merged and released, we should to revert this commit.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add `@angular/compiler-cli` version `8.1.0-next.0` as `peerDependency`" (#14890)

Issues.Title: Compile problem with  @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.800.4
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report




### Description

I have a problem with **@angular-devkit/build-angular 0.800.4** while I did not it with previous version of **@angular-devkit/build-angular**

When I want to compile my project with ng serve I got this error

> ERROR in ./src/app/modules/main/change-password/change-password.component.ts 56:12-21
> "export 'DialogRef' was not found in 'narik-infrastructure'

and this is related to this line of code:

>  @Inject(DIALOG_REF) public dialog: DialogRef<any>

**DIALOG_REF** is an **injectionToken** and DialogRef is a **interface** in external angular package.

I get this error only when I use DialogRef in constructor. If I use it as an usual declaration like
dialog: DialogRef i get no error.



You can see error on this repo: https://github.com/NarikMe/narik-material-demo
_if you change @angular-devkit/build-angular version to "0.800.4"_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Compile problem with  @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.800.4" (#14883)

Issues.Title: Generate Spec File For Existing Component/Service
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [X ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
There are lots of ~~Enterprise~~ Angular Apps that have really spotty testing. There isn't a way to generate a .spec.ts file for an existing component or service. Wiring up a TestingModule for each component is a slow process by hand if you are not familiar with the code base.


### Describe the solution you'd like
The ability to generate a spec file similar to that which `ng generate component` generates but from an existing component or service.

`ng generate spec app.component.ts`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Generate Spec File For Existing Component/Service" (#14872)

Issues.Title: Angular 8 Polyfills ES2015 Bundle Javascript Execution Time is very high - Google Pagespeed shows warning
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 7.x ### Description After upgrading to Angular 8, the Google Pagespeed score of my website has been decreased. One of the warning Pagespeed displays is `Reduce JavaScript execution time`, which is **4.6 seconds**. Its surprising that most of the script execution time is for the "Angular Polyfills ES2015 Javascript bundle" which is **3.8 seconds**. ![angular-polyfills-es2015-javascript-execution-time](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7761180/60018635-4f8e3200-96a5-11e9-85c3-750e4a40ba80.png) Another warning it shows is "Minimize main-thread work" which is **6.5 s** and I think its also due to the polyfills bundle. ![angular-main-thread-work](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7761180/60019007-3d60c380-96a6-11e9-8fae-d4090b3f15d4.png) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Check Pagespeed score for any Angular website with SSR enabled and notice the warnings for the Mobile devices. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: ng build should --prod by default
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description

We maintain an angular component library and we almost could receive dozens of the same question every week, that is 
> `Why the angular build out is so big(3MB or larger)? and why the performance is so poor? we do not want to use it any longer`

when they run `ng build` or `npm run build`

We have to explain that `prod` mode is not the default mode, plz use `ng build --prod` instead.

The `ng build --prod` has been detailed in the official documentation, but many new users just skip the document and just run `npm run build (equals ng build)` in the project generated by `@angular/cli`.

Angular may lose quite a lot of users due to the misunderstanding of `ng build`.
I think it is time to make `--prod` mode default in command `ng build`.


### Describe the solution you'd like
make `--prod` mode default in command `ng build`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

it may bring break changes, but I think most of the angular developers should use `ng build --prod` now
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng build should --prod by default" (#14870)

Issues.Title: MatSelect- "Open Down Always"
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

The logic in the select to figure out whether to open up or down is great, but if we don't want this behavior there's no easy way to get around it.  If we just want the autocomplete to open downward all the time, even if it goes off the screen, or upwards, there should be a way to indicate this.

`@Input positioning: FLEXIBLE | UP | DOWN`

Same concept as `matAutocompletePosition` for Autocomplete

#### Use Case

Client does not want flexible positioning, UI requires the overlay to open "like a drawer" downward at all times
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatSelect- "Open Down Always"" (#16383)

Issues.Title: feat(drag-drop): add support for automatic scrolling
Issues.Body:
* Adds support for automatically scrolling either the list or the viewport when the user's cursor gets within a certain threshold of the edges (currently within 5% inside and outside).
* Handles changes to the scroll position of both the list and the viewport while the user is dragging. Previous our positioning would break down and we'd emit incorrect data.
* No longer blocks the mouse wheel scrolling while the user is dragging.
* Allows the consumer to opt out of the automatic scrolling.

Fixes #13588.
![list-demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/60122076-bafb0100-9784-11e9-9f30-3d0d5b44038b.gif)
![viewport-demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/60122077-bafb0100-9784-11e9-8b23-bf79c4cebb73.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(drag-drop): add support for automatic scrolling" (#16382)

Issues.Title: fix(ng-update): do not rely on node-glob for finding rule directories
Issues.Body:
We currently use `glob` in order to find rule directories automatically. This
has implications because it means that we depend on `glob` that is usually
brought in transitively by other project dependencies. This means that the
glob version is not guaranteed to be working due to previous `glob`
issues on windows.

Related to #16208
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ng-update): do not rely on node-glob for finding rule directories" (#16381)

Issues.Title: mat-tab-group ignores parent width when inside fxLayout row
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

[Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qube6g)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add `mat-tab-group` inside div container having `fxFlexLayout="row"`
2. Add more `mat-tab` elements than the parent container width can display
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The tab header should provide the usual left and right arrow indicating that there are more tabs than the current view shows (as it does if inside a fxLayout="column")

#### Actual Behavior

The tab-group grows in width and actually renders alls tabs even if there is no space. There are no arrows.

#### Environment

- Angular: ^8.0.0
- CDK/Material: ^8.0.1
- Browser(s): Chrome 75.0.3770.100
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-tab-group ignores parent width when inside fxLayout row" (#16371)

Issues.Title: build: fix snapshot local browsers cronjob test
Issues.Body:
The `snapshot_tests_local_browsers` job currently seems
to fail because in order to run the setup snapshots script,
we already need to have the `node_modules` installed. This
means that we need to run Yarn twice for the cronjob. Though
this shouldn't have any performance implications because
we recently updated Yarn to a version that is able to
properly cache/restore the `node_modules`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix snapshot local browsers cronjob test" (#16362)

Issues.Title: mat-select's ARIA hidden attribute is confusing the screen reader from perceiving the control on the page.
Issues.Body:
#### Screenshot

![ARIAHiddenAddedIncorrectly](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51958621/60025858-7e39e780-9668-11e9-8967-5d221946a533.png)
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Please remove the aria-hidden attribute from the markup so that the user using the screen reader can perceive the control and use it effectively.


#### Actual Behavior

Currently, the control includes ARIA hidden attribute which keeps the user using the screen reader from perceiving the control on the page.


#### Environment

- Angular: 7
- CDK/Material: 7
- Browser(s): Chrome/IE
-Screen Reader: JAWS 2019
- Operating System: Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select's ARIA hidden attribute is confusing the screen reader from perceiving the control on the page." (#16369)

Issues.Title: Form field outline gap not calculated when the host element is in a shadow-root
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-567ut9

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a component with view encapsulation set to ShadowDom
2. Use a outline form field in the component's template
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
Outline gap is calculated correctly based on the width of the label

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
No outline gap.

#### Environment

- Angular: 6 ~ 8
- CDK/Material: 6 ~ 8
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form field outline gap not calculated when the host element is in a shadow-root" (#16368)

Issues.Title: bottom-app-bar component
Issues.Body:
## Feature Description
https://material.io/design/components/app-bars-bottom.html

Mentioned in https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13964#issuecomment-441044989
![ezgif-1-b45d38fe5d3a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5334175/48908279-93d3fe00-ee48-11e8-90b1-e658d36ac21d.gif)

Mentioned in https://github.com/angular/components/issues/408#issuecomment-433441313
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9059596/47575154-c6f1a300-d917-11e8-83f4-a8f9fff418d6.png)

### Other Information
MDC does not yet have a `mdc-bottom-app-bar`, but there is a [feature request](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/issues/2659) for one.

There is a separate feature request for a `mat-top-app-bar`: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13964

This has been opened as people keep conflating Bottom App Bars with Bottom Navigation (which we are tracking separately in https://github.com/angular/components/issues/408). Now we can point them to this issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bottom-app-bar component" (#16367)

Issues.Title: refactor(button): change `div` to `span` (#16350)
Issues.Body:
`Div` is categorized by HTML5 spec as flow content.
Button's permitted content is only phrasing content.

Issues.Title: cdkDragFreeDragPosition
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Provide a brief summary of the feature you would like to see.

cdkDragFreeDragPosition should accept x,y in relative units such as vw & vh

#### Use Case

Describe the use case(s) that the proposed feature would enable.

cdkDragFreeDragPosition allows to persist & restore drag position - however it takes only numeric values as px. This affects the responsive webpages and controls do not show up as expected because the transform:translate is set as px values. Currently, it has to be handled manually while loading pages to change the dragposition values based on screen width/height
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "cdkDragFreeDragPosition " (#16364)

Issues.Title: build: use bazel from node modules
Issues.Body:
The goal of https://github.com/angular/components/commit/2ce5ffd56b70c3791331ceedeadc1f1f6daf3924 was to avoid the use of Bazel through the `node_modules`
because it adds unnecessary code overhead, slows down CI and means that
some tools need to be installed multiple times (such as `yarn`). Unfortunately
when building a release with Bazel right now, the bazel workspace status script
depends on the global `node` binary. This means that we need to bring in Node
when running with the `--config=release` flag.. Since that causes inconsistent behavior
and just complicates the setup, we are using Bazel through Yarn for now. Similar to how
we did it for `angular/angular` with https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/8fc4ae51fb66d14f6dc82712a536c3842205fc6d.

We need to revisit this overall approach in the future.. but for now this seems to be the
simplest approach and we don't want too much effort into this yet. Seems like a general
question for #dev-infra where we need to figure out the ideal approach.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: use bazel from node modules" (#16361)

Issues.Title: Submitted state on FormGroup in subcomponent is inconsistent/incorrect
Issues.Body:

- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu & StackBlitz
